nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.a3.common

Interface ItemInfo

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ItemInfo_Impl

    public interface ItemInfo
    Contains info on items in the board. Has a image, the name of the item (name of class), the location and a map of fields in the tile class. For example if the item ins a Key and has an id field the map of fields will contain key="id" value=the value of the id.
     

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object getField(java.lang.String fieldName)
      Gets the value of a given field of this item.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getFieldNames()
      Gets the names of all the fields needed for this item (e.g for a Key the will have an 'id' field).
      java.awt.Image getImage()
      Gets the image for this item.
      java.awt.Point getLocation()
      Gets the location of this item on the board.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Gets the name of the item (e.g 'Key', or 'Chip').
      boolean hasField(java.lang.String fieldName)
      Checks if this item has a given field.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the item (e.g 'Key', or 'Chip').
        Returns:
        the name

      • getImage

        java.awt.Image getImage()
        Gets the image for this item.
        Returns:
        the image

      • getLocation

        java.awt.Point getLocation()
        Gets the location of this item on the board. The location may be null if the item is not on the board (e.g it is in the inventory).
        Returns:
        the location

      • getField

        java.lang.Object getField(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Gets the value of a given field of this item.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - - the feild to get the value of
        Returns:
        the value of the field

      • hasField

        boolean hasField(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Checks if this item has a given field.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - -the name of the field to check for
        Returns:
        whether or not it has the field

      • getFieldNames

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getFieldNames()
        Gets the names of all the fields needed for this item (e.g for a Key the will have an 'id' field).
        Returns:
        a set of the field names
